item.title: How I Setup My Local Python Environment
item.description: I’ve had a few people ask me lately how I setup my local python environment. I am using iterm2 (v3.0.0) on OSX. That means I am using homebrew and I installed wget and curl via brew. /usr/bin/ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)" brew install wget brew install curl Install the python package manager pip wget https://bootstrap.pypa.io/get-pip.py python get-pip.py Install the virtualenvwrapper package. It lets you manage python virtual environments easier than just using virtualenv

item.title: How To Use the Python Debugger aka pdb
item.description: I have been using the Python Debugger aka pdb docs for 2.7/docs for 3.5 a lot recently and wanted to share a cheat sheet I found and also the common commands I use. The cheatsheet: The easiest thing to do is put the following in your code somewhere: import pdb; pdb.set_trace() Then when you run it, it will stop there and you can step through the code a line at a time.

item.title: How to Run a Single Test With Tox
item.description: I have to run a single python test once in a while and keep forgetting how to do it with Tox. Here it is: tox -e py27 -- project_name_here/tests/folder_name1_here/folder_name2_here/test_file_name_here.py:TestClassName.test_method_name Hope this helps someone else. Happy bit twiddling.
